reviewText:
Part 1. Warning Contains Plot Spoilers and is lenghty
With contemporary and future based first person shooters being the current norm I looked forward to a World War 2 based shooter. Some of my best experiences in the first person shooter genre has been games based on the second world war. I saw the game on a steam sale with twenty or so percent off the base price and thought heck I am bored and a WW2 shooter could be fun. The purchase was not a targeted researched acquisition but a spur of the moment shot from the hip hope this is good moment. I took note that the game was based on the Cryengine so with that as a starting point I had plenty of hope for the quality of gameplay and with the attached Cryengine brand demands for decent graphics.

This review is not a concise affair, but rather a rambling of thoughts, ideas and reflections in a semi-structured somewhat coherent text jumbled hastily down. The review solely looks at the single player campaign. I played it at casual and it took me somewhere around 7 hours to pass the campaign. Though keep in mind that I watched a few games of Bullet chess and ate at least one dinner while the game ran paused. So all in all the campaign on casual with an experienced gamer probably lasts five to six hours if played at a leisurely pace.

I ran the game on an older Intel 2500K at 4.3ghz with 16gb ram and a slightly overclocked Nvidia GTX670. Resolution was 2560x1600 with a basic setting on High with DX11. Checking the advanced features it shows all on High. Drivers were the latest as of 17/6/2014. The game version was V1.

I usually have less stringent demands of single player modes when it comes to frame drops etc. than compared to Multiplayer games. I encountered some frame drops, but not to the extent that it bothered me much. Overall the game ran decent on my rig with my perceptions and expectations.
Though I am no graphics ♥♥♥♥♥ I prefer games to look nice. Enemy Front looks decent, maybe not Crysis good but not bad. I met and to an extent passed my expectations on this account.

Moving on to game mechanics I want to say a few words about the buildings in the game. First of I am a big fan of being able to spot a house and go into it. Enemy Front has a classic linear layout with little options and choices for approaching an objective. As a story telling technique I do not mind it, it is widely used and with success. Though sometimes I do feel that I am pushed face first through an area or sequence I much rather would approach in a different manner. When this happens one time too many it feels forced. Enemy Front is in this category. As I went of on a tangent I better return to the buildings. On more than one occasion I have been in situ ready move on closer to the objective and while for instance clearing a tiny hamlet I notice that two out of three buildings are accessible but the third is all locked doors. This is a big thumbs down for me. It makes me think the developers did not bother about their product. In large urban areas it is understandable, to a degree. But not in a three building farm/hamlet.

The game feel fluid, but combat is somewhat odd. Since I played at casual I usually did not take specific care to staying alive. As long as did not have a k98 and run into mp40 equipped AI at point blank range where I missed the first two rounds from my rifle dying is a challenge. You have plenty of time to take on the enemies and if the heat gets too high cover is not far away. The odd part is not how godlike my health is at casual setting but rather the behavior of the AI.
First of the AI is predictable. They will seek cover, peek over, across or to the side of said cover while I am under suppressive fire from multiple enemies. Being cautious has its role but when heavily outgunned and outnumbered the enemy AIs let me take them on one on one with a bolt rifle at game wise short to medium ranges is off. Further if it gets too hot I can fall back ten or so meters and get some cover, possibly around a corner, then they will assault me. Ok not bad, but one at a time? I can sit there and pick them off one by one until the numbers are either depleted enough to go back on the offensive or vanish the enemies entirely. Also the AI is predictable in the sense that it often, maybe too often attempts to flank my position, and not only one of them, but multiple attempts in succession. Two or three pronged assaults have not taken placed unless I have an open vista/space in front of my position. Then they are still more or less coming straight at me.
Second, the AI is deaf or its alternate and has super hearing.  At times I have shot multiple enemies at a distance of 50 to a 100 meters with the next group of AI a similar distance away from me or for that matter a whopping 100-200 meters distance from my rifle blast. Though the group of AI I hunted and killed did not manage to sound an alarm, multiple rifle shots ought to cause some curiosity? On more than one occasion I have had a running SMG / Rifle battle lasting up to a minute, expending considerable ammunition and still the enemy AI groups slightly further out stand about. The alternate are the situations when you are supposed to camoflague your shots with the ambient noise. Here I failed miserably every time... I think it is me but still.
Third. Though probably not an AI specific item the AI often is lackluster at pushing against barricades/static positions where you have to defend. At one of these in the Warsaw part of the campaign, I walked back to the ammo dump slowly reloaded all three weapons (rifle, smg and pistol) before going aim-down-sights expecting the enemy to come across the barriers... nothing happened. I walk up to the barrier and on the other side behind some barriers are the same AI I left behind plus some friends.
Fourth, and the last I can recall. The enemy AI is often funneled against you. If you find a static MG42 in your vicinity its a clear indication that in about ten seconds you will have to man it and go at large groups of enemy AI that runs more or less straight at you. To mow down one group is sort of fun, three or more not so much. At one stage there is an elevated causeway on the V2 mission where we come out of a complex and there is an MG42. I mount it and a sizable group of enemy AI runs at me 50-100 meters away. I take them out then another one comes, then I spot a third coming up the elevator. Traversing the MG over to the open elevator shaft aligning the sights is blast of a burst of 10 or so rounds. Nothing happens? Ok, return to spray and pray blasting the packed elevator for five or so second yields nada. Hmm, what now? Then they turn onto the causeway and brrrmmmm the all go down... Kinda annoying.

The game gives two features in the gameplay. There is a rudimentary system for choice do you want to do A or B or get weapon C or D. An okay twist but nothing more. It is sparsely used at that. Then there is the cinegraphic bullets that you get when using sniper rifles, maybe even rifles, that look nice the first time or so but is not predictable at all, to my understanding, and if I repeat three more or less identical head shots in succession maybe one will give the effect. Then moments later I give a hasty scoped pot shot and viola I get the sequence.

The Oscarsborg mission seems to be a fail. Not because a SOE type and a journalist can take on an entire fortification on their own. Somehow when you get down below and stand there with the persicope thinking you have four torpedoes to make it all good. You observe your target to your left and lead it appropriately. Splash, and on target but somehow there is no explosion? This particular part of the game caused me the biggest problem. How is it the torpedoes goes under the keel of the destroyer on the left side of the outcropping but hits neatly on the other? Makes little sense to me. Its the little things like this that pisses me of.

reviewText: This is a pretty terrible game. I haven't even played it that much. But I'll give credit where credit is due: the graphics are pretty impressive. Wait until this game is on sale for 5 dollars or something, because it's a real waste for the amount of money it's worth now.

reviewText:
Enemy Front is a World War II themed FPS video game released on June 10, 2014 for PC, Play Station 3, and Xbox 360.


I must say that the single player is by far the better aspect of this game, meanwhile its Multiplayer is just beyond horrible with so much unbalanced gameplay mechanism and uninspired MP maps. I can only recommend this game for the SP which is the more tolerable part of this game to play on the PC. While the game does an OK job on the SP, it also shows its issues like sound glitches, random game crashes and it really demonstrates of being a not-so bad console port per say, but it is a shame of such wasted potential on this title while using Crytek's awesome CryEngine3 tech.

Hopefully the devs of this title don't kill their game so soon like ending its support by patching the game with performance improvements and more gameplay improvements because I seen other Indie game devs having a smaller team doing a better job on releasing their content with fluid performance on PCs and great gameplay overall. So for now I can't recommend this game until this Dev team steps up their game by doing the right thing.

reviewText: This is easily the worst game I've spent my money on. The graphics are comparable to Halo CE meaning that they're outdated by at least 10 years, and the AI comparable to a ball placed at the top of a hill, in that it only does one thing from there. The battles and multiplayer are so small scale I'd reccommend having battles with plastic army men over this. I didn't play it long enough to get very far in the campaign so the storyline has potential, but what I saw of it lacked depth and immersion. This game is the worst I own out of all 288 in my Steam library and my physical library of console games. what's worse is that the reviews are full of bots that simply copy paste the same 4 or so positive reviews over and over again. Steam, if you love the community, remove this game so that nobody else has to go through the hell I went through.

reviewText:
I love the idea of a ww2 fps where your not playing as the US , Russia or Japan but rather as a small resistance force.
To be honest, I was expecting a gameplay where u could stealthy avoid detection and have choices how, where and when to eleminate your enemys (Dishonerd, farcry etc but ofcourse these game have a price tag to match).

I have played trough the first couple of single player missions and am really disapointed since the concept has huge potential but what is delivered is the go to a, go to b & blow things up kind of gameplay. No immersion or realism that captures you like u really are in the the resistance and risking your live with every move you make.

As other also noted the ai has the iq of a rock at times but somethimes even when I have hidden myself on the top floor and shoot someone throught the head while planes fly over a random enemy on the courtyard 3 levels below has surpisingly heard not only my gun fire but also knows exactly where I am on the 3rd floor and he rushes in and immediatly calls all his buddies to join who immediatly also now your exact location making camping the door of the room your only option.

I checked other reviews to see about the multiplayer part but nothing mentioned really made me excited to even try it.
Played some more single player today and game started crashing for no reason and with no error report just enemy front .exe stopped working.

At this point I give up on this game in its current state and hope that patches can make it more appealing and really create the vibe that the concept has.
Even with the discount I do not consider this game worth the money.
This game serves as a good example to prove that good" graphics don't make a good game."

reviewText:
This game is a lot of fun! There are a few pros and a few cons on this game, as is the way with all games. So I will just point them out quickly.

Pros:

1) Intuitive and easy gameplay: You start off in the thick of action and you can immediately start performing as if youre a veteran in the game

2) Character mechanics: Your character is very easy to operate. If you hit crouch" while running you do a slide. I didnt need to be told that. I did it on my own within the first few seconds of the game. But you will notice that you need very little instruction and your cdharacter is so easy to navigate through the worlds

3) Cryengine: The graphics are not as good as I expected (more on that later) but Cryengine has great psyhics. And Enemy Front does well in making the most of the engine in this category

4) Choice: Each section of each level has multiple ways to approach it. For example
date:
you need to hold point at the Church. There are two different missions and tactics that you can choose from to achieve this. No matter which you choose you will find side objectives and you can complete the mission stealth or guns blazing or a little of both. I try to sneak through the hard parts and go bezerk on areas where there are only a few enemies.

5) Hit detection system: This is a simple tweak thast makes so much sense. When you shoot an enemy a white "X" means youre hitting them and when you get a red "X" that means the enemy is dead. It makes the FPS environment so much easier and also helps you realize who needs extra bullets and who doesnt. Very cool.

6) Price: I got this on sale for $23. Normal price is $30. Its worth it. I actually thought this would be ideal at a regualr price of $25 and you will see why in the cons

7) Gun Mechanics: The guns are fairly easy to operate. There is recoil but much like a lot of FPS's its sort of put in there just to give the feel of authenticity. But because this game has so many scenes with a lot of action I am glad they didnt spend a lot of time getting the guns to operate true to their real life specs. It wouldve made the game way too hard for most.

There are other pros but those are the first that come to mind.

Now the cons. There arent many and they shouldnt stop you from playing the game. But there are sort of weird
hoursPlayed:
and unexplainable. They dont bother me but they may drive someone nuts. (Usually CoD fans are very particular about other games but havent realized yet that CoD sucks)

Cons:

1) Stupid
voteText: poor quality cut scenes: I've noticed with Crysis series too that cut scenes are not high quality. Which is annoying because youre playing in this super detailed environment and then in between levels you get a back-story that looks like it was made on BetaMax. Not sure why Cryengine games are structured this way. Here we have the bad cut scenes and they have used a 3d still image that the camera pans around while loading a level. Since that image is just as fuzzy as the cut scenes

commentsCount: especially at shallow angles. Certain foliage (and frequently so) have this sort of 1 dimensional Super Mario Bros 3 look and feel. Since the levels are very linear you would think that the player's path would be the cleanest. Ironically its not. Its actually all of the objects taht are out of where you can travel that seem to be flawless (and finished)\n\n3) Graphics Settings (or lack there of): One thing I usually kill shorlty after testing a game is post-processing effects. Here

Anyone with an ASUS monitor knows that having a modified color profile is necessary for proper look and feel. After any adjustments this triggers the profile to be deactivated.\n\n4) Rock Throwing/Aiming: This game plays a lot like Sniper Elite V2. You can even throw a rock to distract an enemy. However

reviewText:
First impression 4 hours into single player campaign:

Enemy Front is a fun game, though there are a few mildly annoying bugs - some objects are missing textures (fireplace, door), A.I. is not especially challenging, and (most important of all) the environment is -not- destructible (with a few exceptions). A big plus for not using quick-time events at all!

Some replay value as you can either be stealthy or storm around shooting up everything, and you can manipulate certain objects to create traps (for example - in one level, you kill a group of enemies by dropping a bunch of treetrunks on their heads, and in another mission by rolling a truck into an enemy camp, and kiling them when the truck hits another truck and explodes).  You can also use an enemy soldier as a meat shield"
date: by holding him hostage at gunpoint while shooting his friends.\n\nAlso included are some entertaining features usually seen in "Sniper Elite"
recommended: such as bulletcam under certain circumstances (when sniping
hoursPlayed: for instance) and the whole "shooting by cover of a loud noise so as not  to be discovered"-thing.\n\nThe story and voice are also pretty decent
voteText: and the game certainly delivers in the "nice graphics" and "ooh
helpfulPercent: shiny"-department. The controls feel a bit like "Medal of Honor: Airborne" to me. Not perfect
votesHelpful: but close enough.\n\nSome people have reported performance issues
votesTotal: but I haven't encountered any (I run with all settings on highest on a mid-range gaming rig). The game has crashed once during the first four hours of gaming.\n\nLook
votesFunny: if you like WW2 FPS
commentsCount: you just might enjoy Enemy Front. I'm having a blast!\n\n(Note: I haven't tried multiplayer at all - MP is not really my thing.)"

reviewText:
So far, what I've played is pretty good. The graphics are on par for any modern shooter, but nothing groundbreaking. The game feels like a WWII Call of Duty game, with more arcade esque gun mechanics. The stealth system gives you the ability to mask gunshots, which is kinda cool, because I don't see it in many games. I have yet to play the Multiplayer section of the game, so my experience is comepletely in Singleplayer. The story breaks the Allies vs Axis powers by putting you in the game as a resistance fighter, making the story fresh compared to many other WWII FPSs. Overall, It's worth the $24 I paid for it.

Also, I did a little first look of the game, if you're interested:
http://youtu.be/z86ieQojEs0

reviewText:
Pros: Good looking WWII shooter - less scripted areas (you can choose stealth or direct assault) than other shooters - DX11 support - Some replayability - 30$ is a better deal than Wolfenstein - Many weapons to choose - Still fun to play.

Cons: Console port with no saving options (only savepoints) - Poor storyline (an excuse to get into maquis and liberation resistance) - Level beautiful but a little drab (some areas are not well decorated feels empty) - AI below average - Ragdoll physics poor (feels like playing Brothers in arms 1") - Mission a bit repetitive.

A game with good potential but fails to deliver fully at the end. Still fun to play tough. I recommend it because they were no good WWII shooter since CODWAW and the price is acceptable. Even its not a open area (like they said) its a good effort of the team."

reviewText:
It's true Enemy Front doesn't offer a whole lot of new gameplay to WW2 FPS games, but that doesn't mean this isn't a whole lot of fun. For the price, you honestly get a hell of a fun, and really pretty game. It's also surprisingly free roam, so you can approach almost every level in any way you want. And a nice little addition is that the sniping is similar to the Sniper Elite series as it slows the action down to offer a dramatic viewpoint of your kill.

The game uses the Cryengine, which really shows its chops even on a lower end PC. CI Games ditched the typical brown look of most FPS games in the last generation, and ops for a more natural aesthetic to the towns and countrysides of Europe... Well, as natural as you can get when everything's been bombed to ♥♥♥♥.

Anyhow, one last thing I wanna mention (that I'm not sure anyone else will care about) is the physics. I don't know what it is, but I love watching the bodies react to the bullets, and especially explosions. Who knows, maybe they added a touch of Just Cause 2 to it, but whatever it is, killing Nazis has never been more fun!

reviewText:
First off I'd like to come out and say that I feel like I got what I paid for. This game is not a AAA game, but it doesn't need to be. It's 30 dollars, and I certainly feel it was worth that. There are good things, and there are some things that need a little work. I'll start with the things that need work. One aspect of sound design needs fixed. When the main character starts a level and is speaking to allies, his voice is completely disconnected from the scene with different audio effects, so you can tell it's out of place. Minor issue. The AI is not very smart, and needs a bit of work. The difficulty level is too easy on the hardest difficulty level. Bump that up. The game needs a form of AA in the options. I could only get FXAA to work, forced through Nvidia. Don't reset my weapons at each major checkpoint. That frustrates me as a player. I ran into one minor glitch where my sniper bullet would not interact with AI that was too far away. It would go right through him. Only happened once that I remember. Fix the mouse sensitivity in the game. Even at the lowest setting my mouse was too sensitive for my tastes, even while it was at halfway in Windows. I had to lower it in control panel. MP needs some anti-cheat. That's important. It also needs ping times to show and a few other options. More people need to jump into MP. When I first bought this game, the times that I played MP were a lot of fun. I had no issues getting it, but it needs tweaked.

Many of the above issues are somewhat minor and not game breaking. The visuals are nice, but don't expect Crysis 3 just because it is using the same engine. Turn post processing down to minimal and you'll get a noticable frame rate boost and much sharper image. I liked the colors used in this game and the out door levels where colors popped and weren't as drab looking as other games of this type. War isn't grey and brown everywhere in real life so it shouldn't be in a game either. The gameplay itself felt really nice and tight. The mouse movement is smooth, responsive, and reminded me of old games that do that right like MOH. Character movement doesn't stop on a dime when letting go of the stick or keys, but is a very slight effect. I was perfectly fine with it and don't even remember experiencing it while playing earlier today. EIther they adjusted it in a patch or I simply overlooked it very early on. The levels are pretty interesting and open, with multiple paths and extra objectives on the side that you can complete. I liked that. My frame rate was always 60fps, partly due to lowering post processing, which also made the game look better. I never had performance issues. When I first got this game I played some MP, but concentrated on SP more so. That's what I usually do with any game. SP first so I can experience the campaign and prime myself for MP. I never had problems getting into MP and the times I did play, I had a lot of fun. Unfortunately people aren't filling up the servers. I liked the MP maps and hope that it picks up at some point. The gameplay felt pretty classic and simple, which is what I like.

I enjoyed both the SP and MP (while I could). This game has a good foundation and could be an above average game with tweaks and patches for some issues. After completing SP I feel the game is worth buying, especially if the devs continue to work and address some things. It isn't perfect, but I didn't expect it to be, and that is no different than a lot of other decent games on here that need some work. I will definitely recommend the game.

Pros:

1) Intuitive and easy gameplay: You start off in the thick of action and you can immediately start performing as if youre a veteran in the game

2) Character mechanics: Your character is very easy to operate. If you hit crouch" while running you do a slide. I didnt need to be told that. I did it on my own within the first few seconds of the game. But you will notice that you need very little instruction and your cdharacter is so easy to navigate through the worlds

3) Cryengine: The graphics are not as good as I expected (more on that later) but Cryengine has great psyhics. And Enemy Front does well in making the most of the engine in this category

4) Choice: Each section of each level has multiple ways to approach it. For example
date:
you need to hold point at the Church. There are two different missions and tactics that you can choose from to achieve this. No matter which you choose you will find side objectives and you can complete the mission stealth or guns blazing or a little of both. I try to sneak through the hard parts and go bezerk on areas where there are only a few enemies.

5) Hit detection system: This is a simple tweak thast makes so much sense. When you shoot an enemy a white "X" means youre hitting them and when you get a red "X" that means the enemy is dead. It makes the FPS environment so much easier and also helps you realize who needs extra bullets and who doesnt. Very cool.

6) Price: I got this on sale for $23. Normal price is $30. Its worth it. I actually thought this would be ideal at a regualr price of $25 and you will see why in the cons

reviewText:
Single player = good.
Multiplayer = unplayable.


Single Player:

The campaign starts off slow, bland and a little boring, but once you get to the flashback levels, the scenery really starts to pop, and it's full of lush colours and beautiful landscapes. The visual style is colourful, something you don't often see in WW2 games, and is a very welcome change.

The music is nice, and at some points beautiful. Weapon sounds are crisp and punchy, and the dialogue from the German enemies is great - and sometimes frightening (there's a certain line that Officers say that is downright scary when you hear it coming from around the corner). Voice acting from the main characters is a little off though, and lacks some charisma.

The story is okay, but lacks real punch, and you find yourself not really caring about the characters much - even though you may sympathise with the WW2 victims.

Weapons and gameplay is a mixed bag. This game is certainly not OPEN WORLD like they claim.  I have yet to find any evidence of open world gameplay. There are a couple of instances where you can make a MULTIPLE CHOICE in the path you wish to take through the level, but that's it. Sometimes you will choose the stealth option, only to have the game force you to breach a door and start a massive firefight. Sniping is FUN, especially when you get a great shot and it goes into bullet-cam. Overall, the gameplay can be described as a generic FPS with ocassional basic stealth.


Multiplayer:

First of all, there are only 4 maps. Secondly, only a handful of servers. Third, I could not connect to ANY of these servers except one (I couldn't join, and the ones I could join disconnected me before the match even begun - yes, even the dedicated servers). When I finally got into ONE server, I (and many others it would seem from the player list) had extreme lag and ping levels in the red.

Multiplayer NEEDS more content and more polish! Add at least another 4 maps, add BOTS if you aren't going to support international players, add some kind of progression or ranking system with unlocks to keep players coming back for more!

Fix fix fix multiplayer, and you could have a great game and capture a loyal WW2 crowd.

Many people have purchased this with hope, so take the time and address the concerns of players now. They would love to have a good game to keep coming back to over and over, both in single player and especially multi player.

reviewText:
If you're sick of those modern shooters (or even future shooters, where you get to kill the bad guys in space) with their unrealistic storylines, and you remember your excitement when you've played Medal of Honor: Allied Assault or first Call of Duty, look no further!
Enemy Front may be rough-around-the-edges a bit, but bear in mind it's not an AAA title created by multi-milion company with unlimited budget. For 30 bucks it's a good deal, and if you manage to find it on a sale and don't buy it - shame on you.
Quick summary:
+nostalgia
+WWII settings
+fine visuals
+good audio (weapon sounds and German shouted commands)
+interesting storyline (Polish resistance, Warsaw Uprising etc.)
+good ol' multiplayer (similar to CoD2)

-a bit too short
-needs polishing in some places
-sometimes the physics can go weird
-disappearing corpses (seriously?)
-no or very little blood / not enough gore
-Poles and the French speaking perfect English (why can't you let them speak their own languages and apply subtitles?)

Overall: Go, get it!

Side note: holding my fingers crossed for a story DLC. Multiple story DLCs to be precise.

reviewText: This game has some good and some bad going for it as I can tell so far. Now, for me personally the pros outweigh the cons. I have seen in other reviews that there are reports of a lot of bugs and glitches, but I can't say I have experienced the same. Only one very minor bug, that was more amusing than anything. I have not played the multiplayer yet, however that is not why I bought this game. My suggestion is if you're looking for an online WWII shooter experience, you're probably not going to find it here, at least for the time being. That being said, the singleplayer is quite fun. Granted, the game is not as open as promised, but I think that has been stated enough by others.\n\nVisually the game is eye candy, and the models for most characters are well done. The audio is much the same, plus the sounds of the weapons are very nice, and so are the voices of the Germans. However, the voice acting of one of the main characters, who is a resistance fighter, is a little off". I find myself wondering just what accent he is supposed to have

reviewText: The setting is fresh and new as the genre goes, but the execution leaves a lot to be desired. The game is clearly unoptimized and unpolished. Nonetheless, this game has a great concept and recipe and it has the potential to be an excellent game if only the devs would keep putting effort into the game (although the news I've heard over it makes this seem unlikely).

reviewText:
I ♥♥♥♥ing love WWII FPS games, but what I don't like about them is being broken as ♥♥♥♥. Enemy Front is one of those games where it wants to be better than CoD (which I totally understand), but the game performs negatively on what it's trying to have you do. I have not bothered finishing the game since it has so many damn issues I can't handle it anymore so I'm just gonna go ahead and get on with the review.

Since this game is running on the CryEngine 3 I'm going to say that the game is not optimized at all. When I looked at it's minimum requirements I was thinking oh this game should run perfectly fine on my system I mean ♥♥♥♥ it looks good...nope. I barely get 45 - 60 in the game on med - high settings and I know which part of the settings are gonna be the FPS hogs in the game. When lots of explosions and effects happen it drops down to about 20 - 30...good lord. Now I know I can play Crysis n all just fine with the engine, but when this doesn't thats poop optimization. Another thing is the graphics don't even look that good either, but I can care less about that tho. Oh and they really ♥♥♥♥ed up on DX9 mode. DX11 may be sorta poopy, but switching to DX9 for me made it even worse. My game was corrupted as crap until I switched back to DX11 so I'm forced to play the game properly on DX11. Terrible!

The AI are slow as crap. I can just pass right by and the meter wouldn't go that fast. Another thing is I played this on the hardest difficulty and they sometimes shoot like Stormtroopers and the amount of damage I take feels like I was playing on Easy this whole time. I kinda feel like I'm playing Far Cry 3 when I'm tryin to screw with the enemy AI, but in a broken way. It's safe to say that the AI in the game are semi-braindead, though not as braindead as the Wolfenstein TNO AI.

With a lot of flaws that were overlooked in this game there are some things I liked about it. I actually like that they give you open-ended levels where you can either go loud or stealth through (I'll get to the stealthing topic in a few.) The game doesn't have you wait for a certain interactive cutscene to slow you down like CoD and having mapping that is completely linear and will not give a choice on how you want to go through. I hate when modern FPS becomes so linear you have to wait for something to happen, have your team AI move on first and you last, and force you to go loud or stealth w/o giving you a choice. This game let's you perform how you want to progress through and that's something I like. I also like the weapons in the game too. I love the way they work and sound like MP40. The MP40 in the game is like a real MP40. Only problem with the weapons is that they are like pea shooters. I try to get a head shot and sadly it takes 2 hits in the head to count as a headshot...wtf game...wtf. Another thing is using a molotov is very...damn...slow.

Speaking of weapons and choices let's talk about the stealthing. I dislike the stealth mechanic. I think the stealthing is completely pointless. Some of you think it's fine, but to me it's just a joke. When it comes to stealthing it sometimes may work or sometimes it doesn't. Another thing that really pisses me off is that silent weapons are like rare to find in the game making it a bit difficult to stealth. When you sneak behind an enemy and perform an silent attack the kill is super damn slow. What I like to do instead is just take one of them as a hostage, move them somewhere where I can;t be spotted, and kill the nazi. Rock throwing is pretty useless the nazis are freaking deaf.

The story is bland the the objectives are weak. The game is just throwing random ♥♥♥♥ at ya sometimes and due to it's flaws n all it can sometimes make the game tough to get through. The story is boring and the characters are not interesting at all. Voice acting is pretty crap and whole bunch of bull honky. I haven't completed the game because of it's crappyness so I'm just gonna move on.

Overall the game looks good n all, but it has lots and lots and lots and lots and LOTS of problems and I cannot play through this game anymore. I realized it really was a waste of money and my time and I still feel guilty for refunding my Sniper Elite III pre-order just for the TF2 Love & War Update.

3/10! I like what it is trying to be, but it has failed to perform correctly as this game is unoptimized, buggy, and boring with it's story and objectives. I also heard that the multiplayer is awful and dead. If you guys want to try this because you really love WWII FPS then wait for it to go on sale or maybe get Sniper Elite III, Red Orchestra II/Rising Storm, Wolfenstein, or the classic Call of Duty 2. Maybe don't bother with this one at all.

reviewText:
so i have 6 hours on record of playing, both a little MP and SP
lets starts with multi player.

i actually enjoyed it - reminds me of old skool shoot em up. i found the hit detection to be good.
but limited to only 4 maps is abit disapointing. i noticed a DLC menu in the game which suggests new maps will be added.
the graphics are not on par with SP. players expreince bad pings, but i myself have never had lag on multi player.
there is a good choice of weapons to loadout, and everythings unlocked from go.

overall - i think imo MP of enemy front is a fun run and gun game, yes there is campers, i was one of them. when i loaded out with a scoped K98, its pretty fun snipering each other from one end of map to the other. and fun enough to keep you enjoying jogging around with a tommy or tench gun and blasting away.  theres nothing really new added to enemy front MP that we havent already seen but it is fun.

Single player - i'll first start with it does have bugs, for example i switched my pistol to sniper rifle and there was floating hands holding a pistol and when i pressed reload the floating hands reloaded the pistol. it was funny to watch but it is a bug. another bug i encounted was the sky wasnt rendering correctly and i had to kill game and restart. the graphics are nice, textures are decent enough. its just really nice to look at, there a multiply routes on some levels to gain your objetive.
take whatever route you like, you will always end up at the same objetive. but it is fun. the enmey AI can be compared to Lioyd from dumb and dumber. i shoot nazi another nazi will take up his place where he just died. they seem to follow a set route that was coded into them, when i use silenced weapons they didnt notice that one of their men had been killed, so thats good.

i would recommed this game. but please beware it has bugs, but its a hell of a lot of fun in SP and MP is ok but some players are complaining of lag and connection issues.

i have enjoyed it so far and hopefuly devs will patch issues.

reviewText: I liked the game, but honestly the story was a bit thin and there was a lack of character development. Don't get me wrong, the environment was beautifully rendered and forward combat was intense, but the sneaking could stand to be redesigned. The levels give you the option of being sneaky, but the overly sensitive enemies hardly allow room for that. The campaign could have been a tad longer - particularly with the DLC, which is only one 5-10min mission. I was also disappointed to see the same weapons over and over again. These are things that can be patched - overall I enjoyed the game, but wouldn't pay full price for it. 6.5/10 from me

reviewText:
This game is very fun. I'm going to go over a few problems a lot of whiney games have with this game.

Singleplayer: The AI is dumb. yes this is true even on expert so as for a singleplayer game, enjoy it while it lasts and get what you can out of it, but I bought this for multiplayer so this isn't an issue for me.

Everyone says they get low FPS. Thats because they try to run ultra settings on DIRECT X 11 with a 280gtx. Not going to work. Either upgrade your computers or turn off DIRECT X 11 and switch to DIRECT X 9. I honestly saw very little difference in terms of graphic quality with the two, except I got a huge FPS gain by switching to 9. So for all you morons out there, turn your damn shader quality down.

Mutliplayer: There are dedicated servers, this isnt a cod style matchmaking system. The only thing I don't like is the server size is a little small. If they increase it to like a 10v10 or more that would be amazing! Along with some bigger maps. I've had no issue with FPS or lag or HITBOXES like all these other people are talking about, maybe they should stop playing from cambodia and upgrade their internet. Hitboxes in this game register VERY well. I was online just blasting kids all day long especially with their loud romper stomper feet. I don't think people understand this is slightly more of a stealthy shooter, not COD run and gun.

The game is fun, its got a lot of multiplayer value and future potential. I'm excited to see what else they add in the future. Great WW2 stealth shooter. Don't buy it if you want a super refined polished game with thousands of features. The games small and so is the price, no complaints.

reviewText: i was a little nervous picking this one up, because of what it is, a fps set in ww2, but i thought what the hell, it might be good. i'll give credit were its due and say thats its nice. its not a game changer by any stretch of the imagination but its nice. check out my first impresions video here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=n0xgCVPVChQ\n\ni do have issues with it. it's obviously a console port, the controls are klunky at times, the loading times are terrible. but it kept me entertained and made me remember many early fps's like medal of honour allied assult. in fact that is what it is, exept your a news reporter in poland and france and norway, rather than an american soldier in north africa, norway or france.... but yeah buy this game when it drops in price if i was you. 6/10

reviewText:
I have enjoyed may of their games such as alien rage and ghost warrior 1 and 2

CI Games	 has yet to make another great game in my opinion. Enemy front is made with the crisis engine set in WWII. This game is literally beautiful along with the animations and the models. Wooden objects can be shot through/broken. This game also gives you options on which way you would like to take such as front door or back door. The game does have a nice stealth system along with the hostage holding.  These developers can make some good games but they really need to focus more on programing along with fixing bugs.

Take enemies hostage
choices on what to do
Stealth or go loud
Bullet drop

huge map to where you can go almost anywhere
Graphics amazing

reviewText:
Ok first off let me start with saying, that I loved the trailer. Its what caught my eye. Out of the gate I decided to multiplayer first. The bad news for MP at this moment, not that many servers (could be not that many playing the game Death match worked. But Team Death Match I could not get to work.), second bad thing for MP is not being able to join them. Bad connection probs or something. But once you get in, a whole new can of WHUP ♥♥♥ is greeted. Small in size the maps seem, but lots of places to quickly set fast hit and run ambushes. First time, I had to get used to the style, and then second round, I ruled the leader board.
Secondly, I decided to give the Campaign/Story Mode a run at. I loved the visual opening, And then the nice little lead in, to the point where you actually take control. The graphics are nicely done. Controls feel great. Loved using the plane fly by sounds to mask my shots. Even stealth killing was good (have yet to try the hostage taking bit, but I am sure I will). Was not aware of secondary objective(s), as my first mission told me I missed the secondary (would have been nice to know of them at the start). I love the distraction part of the game. Helped me out in a few tight spots. The only downer part for me so far, is that the game locked up on me as I was moving into a break in a wall of a building that lead what looked like a tunnel.
Beyond that. I would recommend this game to anyone that likes a slow but not to slow paced of a FPS. There are times where the action does get hot and heavy from what I have seen so far (have yet to complete the game). But if your into some old school weapons and the feel of WW2. Then this may tempt your taste buds.
On a scale of 1-10.
I rate this about 8.5 over all. A good experiance... But could use a bit more tinkering. And I am sure it woudl be that much better.

reviewText:
Enemy Front
i don`t know where to start. This game has some great potencial. First off im a ww2 fanatic and would love to see more ww2 games. I`m tired of the futuristic crap.
But what enemy front is trying to achieve is something that feel just to much as the same old ww2 shooters we`ve seen before.

Lets start off with the pros:

Nice graphics
the killcam is always a thrill
different approaches as for instance stealth or run and gun
a few guns and variations previously not seen in a ww2 shooter
the game is set in an area that have not previously been explored in a ww2 fps game.


Cons:
the game does not feel finished, after playing for a few hours i`ve come across alot of bugs, these are smaller ones but rather annoying.
the game should be more like an open world, it feels like the game is telling you where to go or at least it gives you nothing more than max three pathways to your target.


since Enemy front is one of the few more recent ww2 games it`s quite difficult to compare it up to other ww2 games.

I would give it a 7,5/10

reviewText: This is a CI games title, expect three things with all their games: good graphics, solid gameplay and some degree of jank. for me the level of jank is relatively low this time around. The title runs smoothly and no texure stretching (EX: Sniper Ghost Warrior). The janky parts for me are some of the animations being to stiff and the story being to jarring and complex to follow.\n\nIn summary, solid purchase at a discount

reviewText: Heyyo, it is fun... but tbh I had more fun with Brother In Arms: Hell's Highway and Medal of Honor: Airborne. Call of Duty 5 also gets an honorable mention since it too was fun, I'd say on par with Enemy Front. The multiplayer community is non-exsistent much like MOH: Airborne's was... but the singleplayer is the main part of the game anyways, and it does well in that regard. Graphics on Cryengine 3 is great on this game, but they're not system-breaking like Crytek's shooters but that's fine by me since it's still an extremely appealing game to look at. Gun sounds are on par with BIA Hell's Highway but the levels are a bit claustrophobic much like MOH: Airborne. For the price of $30 on release? I'd say maybe wait until a price drop to $20. :)

reviewText:
Enemy Front is a curious game in the FPS universe: being a low budget WWII game running on the famous CryEngine one would not really know what to expect. Truth is, while Enemy Front does not fully explore its untapped potential, it still provides a most enjoyable ride.

To begin with: graphics are good, really good. It truly creates a captivating atmosphere. Be warned, however: the game is poorly optimised, and thus framerate drops may be recurrent.

Regarding sound, Music is absolutely fantastic. It has got a remarkable OST that will remain with you long after ending a mission. Voice acting, however, is somewhat lacklustre, and weapon sounds just feel bland.

Now, on to gameplay:

Shooting works just fine, but I do have a minor complaint to make: weapons lack a certain oomph" to it when fired. Maybe removing that ugly cross that pops up whenever you hit a target just to let you know you landed a shot would allow you to savour the moment all the more.

Melee is
recommended: absolutely disgusting. You get to an enemy up front
hoursPlayed: give him hell with the stock of your rifle and he will just fall sluggishly on his back
voteText: as if slowly falling asleep or something. That
helpfulPercent: and the lack of some powerful sound when meleeing them makes for some appaling close quarters. This might just be the worst thing about the game. Truly
votesHelpful: I end up shooting everyone I am about to melee
votesTotal: just to spare myself of the despicable sight of enemies falling to their dreams - yup
votesFunny: you read that right.\n\nStealth
commentsCount: however
column16: works like charm
column17: and that's something I didn't expect from this game. It's not like it's a major feature or anything
column18: but the game's designed in such a way that you can play each and every level either up front or sneaking your way behind the enemy lines - or a mixture
column19: for that matter. This makes for multiple ways to tackle an enemy stronghold
column20: a mission or the entire game itself for that matter. You can stealth kill enemies from behind or even take them hostages to use either as meat shield or to silently get rid of them somewhere else. And you know what? You can even pick up bodies and throw them wherever you choose
column21: so as to avoid detection by your enemies. A GREAT feature that should exist in all games.\n\nEnemy Front delivers an enjoyable and unique experience in the genre. It has some rough edges
column22: but you shouldn't let that mar your experience.\n\nFor 29.99
column23: I deem this a 4/5. Excellent game."

The graphics and textures are quite pretty, for the first 5 minutes. Then you start to see problems with everything else.

reviewText:
5/10   This game is poorly made by an unheard of company. AI's like to walk into walls, and even in the midst of combat, will charge and treadmill (in place running) in front of you, before actually doing anything that could help them. The characters' mouths are similar as to those of Far Cry 2, whose mouths were BARELY and POORLY synced by 10 year olds. Even at the highest graphic qualities the cinematics (not gameplay) were complete s**t quality. Maps are poorly created, as I have a few screenshots of floating objects, especially books.. I believe this company was trying to rush their game development, but obviously that didn't work out too well now did it?
Enemy german soldiers for some reason speak in English, with an AMERICAN accent.. Okay since when did Germans become Americans in World War II?
Alongside those problems, there are hitbox problems, basically.. shooting AT an enemy (even like 10 feet away from him) will kill him, making you seem more skilled than you actually are. (Which isn't such a bad thing if you like pick-em-up-shooter games)
ALSO THE BIGGEST THING I DO NOT LIKE ABOUT THIS GAME HAS TO BE THE ACT OF BEING COPYCAT! The game's intro to missions is a copycat of Halo 3's Official Trailer, some parts of the game, when you shoot an enemy with a headshot, a bullet sequence that COPIES Sniper Elite comes into vision, which undoubtfully is a mimic of it. There is also a distraction method in the game, which is THROWING A ROCK to divert enemies attention.. Remember that from some game? Oh yeah! FAR CRY 3! And the last reference has to be the obvious one, CALL OF DUTY mimicking! From the ♥♥♥♥♥♥ gunplay, all the way to breaching doors in slow-mo, which is what Call of Duty established somewhat first (and to be honest, CoD is s**t).

On the bright side!  This game features the beautiful CryEngine 3, which makes the game look initially good, UNTIL you start seeing objects appearing in front of you (Ambient Occlusion that is HORRIBLE)
Also this game features a Dynamic soundtrack, which is very well placed, and actually can make the game interesting at certain parts.

Overall, this game would've been a lot better if the game wasn't rushed too much, didn't copy about every game on the market, and could actually optimize their visual engine so that even good computers can play it without having such ambient occlusion interferences.

Alongside those problems, there are hitbox problems, basically.. shooting AT an enemy (even like 10 feet away from him) will kill him, making you seem more skilled than you actually are. (Which isn't such a bad thing if you like pick-em-up-shooter games)
ALSO THE BIGGEST THING I DO NOT LIKE ABOUT THIS GAME HAS TO BE THE ACT OF BEING COPYCAT! The game's intro to missions is a copycat of Halo 3's Official Trailer, some parts of the game, when you shoot an enemy with a headshot, a bullet sequence that COPIES Sniper Elite comes into vision, which undoubtfully is a mimic of it. There is also a distraction method in the game, which is THROWING A ROCK to divert enemies attention.. Remember that from some game? Oh yeah! FAR CRY 3! And the last reference has to be the obvious one, CALL OF DUTY mimicking! From the ♥♥♥♥♥♥ gunplay, all the way to breaching doors in slow-mo, which is what Call of Duty established somewhat first (and to be honest, CoD is s**t).

On the bright side!  This game features the beautiful CryEngine 3, which makes the game look initially good, UNTIL you start seeing objects appearing in front of you (Ambient Occlusion that is HORRIBLE)
Also this game features a Dynamic soundtrack, which is very well placed, and actually can make the game interesting at certain parts.

Overall, this game would've been a lot better if the game wasn't rushed too much, didn't copy about every game on the market, and could actually optimize their visual engine so that even good computers can play it without having such ambient occlusion interferences.

reviewText:
Got the Limited edition for 10 euros retail. It has many nice features like 4 multiplayer characters and some maps. Don't worry about spending hours to find a good server to play: there is only one and I cannot get into it because it has a password. And it is a French server. The French lost the war.

At least the single player is good. Graphics are so very modern that even blood looks just like in Soldier of Fortune 2. The game is historically correct. The germans are so ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ it's no wonder they lost the war. They walk into the same spot where 5 others were just killed, a common tactic employed by Rommel. Also, the game is very open. You can choose to walk into the objective through the main path or chose one or two other which affect the gameplay none whatsoever. So there is much replay value.

At least you see a different viewpoint of the war.

reviewText:
Enemy Front is a pretty decent stealth based WWII shooter. The visuals look nice and the gameplay is enjoyable, if a bit generic. While not anything close to the funnest or most inspiring shooter I have played I found it all around decent, or average in most aspects. The game itself can be pretty buggy however as I found myself repeatedly fighting invisible Nazis, being sucked through floors and walls, or even stranger wacky bugs that made me wonder if this game took place in a timeline where everything was made by Acme Corp.

Another closing note I want to add is that the multiplayer is very dead, so unless you are up for looking for people to play with on the community hub, or having friends who already play you probably are going to have a hard time getting a game.

All in all I find Enemy Front acceptable.

reviewText:
Enemy Front
i was so looking forward to a new WW2 game to play. I love playing cod - cod uo - cod 2 - cod waw etc. so this was the best thing that could happen.

I guess i wanted it to be better then what it realy was. i could say i was disapointed but i cant say that i truly are disapointed.. it kinda goes both ways.

First of all I hate to look at all the clips in the begining before the game startes.. you know the makers and engines and stuff.. ill press esc as a mad man to make them go away :P

So there i was in the begining menu of the game.. and damn that menu was so freaking promising and good. and the short video load screens are awesome.

so when i started the singel player mission i was xcited. and beeing from norway and kneew that norwegian maps would be added i couldent wait for that story line to happen.

when playing it was mixed feeling. a feeling between playing COD UO and call of juarez .- im not dissapointed about the enemy" but there where some bugs here and there that realy shooked me sinse i had so great hopes for this game.. ive posted 2 screenshots from this on my profil.. flying in the air books and a enemy ghost inside a wall ..

all that beside i still loved moving around and shooting stuff. but when i got to the point where i had found a silencer weapon  and i could realy stealth it.. i was so frustrated when i came to a  checkpoint and lost thoose weapons .. wtf.. let me keep them :(

afther that point all the negativities started to infeltrate my head.
like missions could go on and on and on and on if you dident do what was xpected to do even though it was all over.
i got like strange missions and couldent quite make them work as i think the plans for it was.

sometimes you had to rush like hell for not been randomly killed at that point and sometimes if you rushed the ai player got stucked or bugged.

i remember one of the landscapes.. city like.. i feelt like my character was a dwarf at some point.. not that its something wrong with that. but i think they mad some bad judgement in some of the layout.

so ive finnishd the singelplayer mission.. done some multyplayer action..

and i came to the conqlution that yes you could buy the game if you whant it and are a fan of ww2 games etc.
but dont xpect to much of it. its not a 100/100 game
if i could rate it.. it would be a 55/100

I had fun playing it. hoped it would be better but maybe next time :)"

reviewText:
Its hard to recommend this game, but it wasn't a bad effort. Just feels like they kind of ran out of ideas as it is a very short game. Quite fun while it lasted but just leaves you feeling like it should have been released at half the price. Its certainly got potential and hopefully if they get enough sales they will work on a more polished sequel.
Graphically its very nice, but certain features just don't work. The stealth aspect seems a bit pointless, you can stand in front of a guard that is shining a light in your face, but if you step behind a tree he doesn't realise you are there. Quite funny but not really in a good way.
This game is best played as a run and gun style and to this end it does everything very nicely, although slightly by the book.
I'd give this a 6 out of 10, not bad by any means but it won't be scaring any of the big name developers.

reviewText: Not bad for $25. I mean, it's not great either, but the game is long enough to warrant the price. The levels also have a bit of replay value to them because you can do stealth kills in a lot of places if you want to. It has some bugs, but only a couple forced me to restart a checkpoint. Doing a stealth takedown apparently picks a random kill animation which can put you inside a wall, which is more amusing than frustrating. Anyways, I would say buy this game, especially if it goes on sale. It's a good distraction while waiting for something else to come out.

reviewText:
When I found a set of stairs I couldn't walk up because 1 step was larger than the others, or when I shot an enemy 7 times but saw the bullets hit the wall behind him, or when I blew up a wall and nothing happened, that's when I thought gg, there goes my money.

Campaign and Story
The story started at a horrible place (in the middle of shooting stuff up for no reason), and the campaigns pacing is horrible. You are thrown into a battle as a bloodlusting, nazi-killing journalist who has to try to figure out what people with thick accents are telling him to do, while navigating a colorful underpopulated world of evil nazis. - 3/10

Shooting and FPS.
Hitting people with guns is like a freakish nightmare, not only do the weapons take up most of the screen but the sights are horrible. reviewText:
A typical ww2 shooter from the 90's with updated graphics... Im kinda dissapointed as i hoped for more. Unfortunately it seems like the game was rushed for a release just after the d-day anniversary, and it shows...
There are quite a bit of bugs and stuff there just isnt made good enough, (npc's running into walls and getting stuck. Bad animations when npc's are using stuff (npc opening a door but isnt touching it, npc weapons flying while npc is havbing it in his hands, and loads of other things like that) also the video part between missions seems to end very wierd, almost like they crash at the end, and throwing you into the mission.
Another dissapointment is the main story in the game, it is very thin and just stops at a random point.

One of the better parts about this game is the weapons, as there are quite a few that you dont see in most ww2 games, like the Welrod. Also the game is cheap

reviewText: CI Games has a troubled history with shooters. From the Sniper series to Alien Rage, the studio has a habit of releasing critically slated shooters it taglines as hardcore" and "revolutionary". To further this effort
date: CI Games recently recruited the talent of Stuart Black to its new London offices. So
recommended: does this newly added talent help CI to create a great game? No
hoursPlayed: but they might be learning how.\n\nEnemy Front makes good on carrying on the tradition of grandiose CI game descriptions
voteText: billing itself as the "first truly modern WW2 FPS". I'm not really 100% sure on what constitutes a "truely modern" video game anymore
helpfulPercent: but I can see this coming from a number of different perspectives. Most likely I believe is probably the graphical capabilities of the game
votesHelpful: which are quite nice seeing as Enemy Front runs on CryEngine 3 technology. The game looks fantastic in most levels
votesTotal: complete with signature CryEngine light shafts and snow effects. Aside from a few issues with scale
votesFunny: most of the environments and models are decently accurate to their real world counterparts
commentsCount: and weapons look and sound more accurate then I expected from a budget action title. Ambient noise seems to be all but non-existent however
column16: making the environments feel much more sparse then they look. Some of the levels do contain musical cues to make up for this
column17: and when they do the music thankfully is very well done
column18: and extremely cinematic. Enemy Front runs smoothly for most of the game
column19: but there were a few places where the frame rate dropped dramatically and consistently for no apparent reason. In addition to random FPS drops
column20: I also constantly encountered a strange bug which caused Enemy Front to set its volume level in the Windows 7 mixer to 25%
column21: causing the game to either constantly be soft
column22: or forcing me to tab out of the game to open my volume mixer every 30 minutes to an hour. Aside from these complaints
column23: the game looked and ran pretty decently.\n\nSo Enemy Front has pretty decent graphics and sound
column24: but that's mostly expected with a game that has a big name licensed engine behind it. So what about the game play? Well
column25: this is were things start to fall apart

column27: an American journalist trapped in the middle of the Warsaw uprising. The game starts with Hawkins making an impassioned radio plea for assistance from inside the embattled Warsaw

column29: this is about the extent of the historical accuracy Enemy Front concerns itself with. After the well done and touching opening cinematic

column31: which you use for most of the first half of the game to move between levels. Enemy Front then gives you an option of which level to proceed to

column48: in many cases the only challenge poised by my foes was the massive amount of damage I took if I did manage to get hit.\n\nProbably the biggest I have with the main single player of Enemy Front is the story. The story starts in the middle of the Warsaw uprising

reviewText:
After a few more hours of playing, I've finally figured out my main gripes with Enemy Front.

This isn't a terrible game, but it just isn't special in any way. While the visuals are nice (but not excellent by comparison to any other modern shooter), the gameplay is clunky, movement feels sluggish, and the entire game feels generally unfinished. While there is a campaign, and a story that goes along with it, it holds no narrative depth whatsoever. I can see what the developers were trying to do - follow the character development of a news reporter who turns from someone exploiting the resistence movement for a good story to a freedom fighting partisan, and that's a good idea on paper. But in practice, there isn't much more than a few pre-rendered cutscenes that do little more than superficially show this hasty development.

To the games credit, it tries its best not to remain boring, or stay in one place for too long. The story shifts all around the WWII theatre, with missions taking place in France, Poland and other key areas of the war. There is always ammunition and explosives lying around to play with, and a focus on stealth to dispatch enemies quietly (with a pretty good hostage-taking system to get around areas peacefully, or just have a human shield to soak up bullets). But the flaw in Enemy Front is that it is too linear for the ideas it wishes to convey. There are no character upgrades, or special perks that can be looked forward to down the line. Apart from a few collectable Reich insignias (which do nothing), there is no reward for exploring or any incentive to replay the campaign. Despite the focus on stealth, the system is unclear and just not very fun to use.

I haven't had any luck with the multiplayer, as any matches that I actually managed to connect to (3 out of 35) were unpopulated, or suffered drop-outs within seconds. If a future patch fixes this, I'll be sure to correct this.

I really want to like this game, because WWII shooters have a massive place in my heart, especially the original Call Of Duty and Medal of Honor games. While Enemy Front appears to cater to my nostalgia at certain points, it raises the question: If throwing-back to the first shooter games is all Enemy Front can offer, why shouldn't I just play the old games instead of this one? I noticed on the menu that there is a DLC" page

reviewText:
When I found a set of stairs I couldn't walk up because 1 step was larger than the others, or when I shot an enemy 7 times but saw the bullets hit the wall behind him, or when I blew up a wall and nothing happened, that's when I thought gg, there goes my money.

Campaign and Story
The story started at a horrible place (in the middle of shooting stuff up for no reason), and the campaigns pacing is horrible. You are thrown into a battle as a bloodlusting, nazi-killing journalist who has to try to figure out what people with thick accents are telling him to do, while navigating a colorful underpopulated world of evil nazis. - 3/10

Shooting and FPS.
Hitting people with guns is like a freakish nightmare, not only do the weapons take up most of the screen but the sights are horrible. Even if you do manage to aim and shoot, you won't neccesarily hit because the bullets don't hit enemies most of the time. The target hit" marker is inconsistent sometimes in the singleplayer

reviewText:
A typical ww2 shooter from the 90's with updated graphics... Im kinda dissapointed as i hoped for more. Unfortunately it seems like the game was rushed for a release just after the d-day anniversary, and it shows...
There are quite a bit of bugs and stuff there just isnt made good enough, (npc's running into walls and getting stuck. Another dissapointment is the main story in the game, it is very thin and just stops at a random point.

One of the better parts about this game is the weapons, as there are quite a few that you dont see in most ww2 games, like the Welrod. Also the game is cheap

reviewText:
Enemy Front
i was so looking forward to a new WW2 game to play. I love playing cod - cod uo - cod 2 - cod waw etc. so this was the best thing that could happen.

I guess i wanted it to be better then what it realy was. i could say i was disapointed but i cant say that i truly are disapointed.. it kinda goes both ways.

First of all I hate to look at all the clips in the begining before the game startes.. you know the makers and engines and stuff.. ill press esc as a mad man to make them go away :P

So there i was in the begining menu of the game.. and damn that menu was so freaking promising and good. and the short video load screens are awesome.

so when i started the singel player mission i was xcited. and beeing from norway and kneew that norwegian maps would be added i couldent wait for that story line to happen.

when playing it was mixed feeling. a feeling between playing COD UO and call of juarez .- im not dissapointed about the enemy" but there where some bugs here and there that realy shooked me sinse i had so great hopes for this game.. ive posted 2 screenshots from this on my profil.. flying in the air books and a enemy ghost inside a wall ..

all that beside i still loved moving around and shooting stuff. but when i got to the point where i had found a silencer weapon  and i could realy stealth it.. i was so frustrated when i came to a  checkpoint and lost thoose weapons .. wtf.. let me keep them :(

afther that point all the negativities started to infeltrate my head.
like missions could go on and on and on and on if you dident do what was xpected to do even though it was all over.
i got like strange missions and couldent quite make them work as i think the plans for it was.

sometimes you had to rush like hell for not been randomly killed at that point and sometimes if you rushed the ai player got stucked or bugged.

i remember one of the landscapes.. city like.. i feelt like my character was a dwarf at some point.. not that its something wrong with that. but i think they mad some bad judgement in some of the layout.

so ive finnishd the singelplayer mission.. done some multyplayer action..

and i came to the conqlution that yes you could buy the game if you whant it and are a fan of ww2 games etc.
but dont xpect to much of it. its not a 100/100 game
if i could rate it.. it would be a 55/100

I had fun playing it. hoped it would be better but maybe next time :)"

reviewText:
Its hard to recommend this game, but it wasn't a bad effort. Just feels like they kind of ran out of ideas as it is a very short game. Quite fun while it lasted but just leaves you feeling like it should have been released at half the price. Its certainly got potential and hopefully if they get enough sales they will work on a more polished sequel.
Graphically its very nice, but certain features just don't work. The stealth aspect seems a bit pointless, you can stand in front of a guard that is shining a light in your face, but if you step behind a tree he doesn't realise you are there. Quite funny but not really in a good way.
This game is best played as a run and gun style and to this end it does everything very nicely, although slightly by the book.
I'd give this a 6 out of 10, not bad by any means but it won't be scaring any of the big name developers.

reviewText: Not bad for $25. I mean, it's not great either, but the game is long enough to warrant the price. The levels also have a bit of replay value to them because you can do stealth kills in a lot of places if you want to. It has some bugs, but only a couple forced me to restart a checkpoint. Doing a stealth takedown apparently picks a random kill animation which can put you inside a wall, which is more amusing than frustrating. Anyways, I would say buy this game, especially if it goes on sale. It's a good distraction while waiting for something else to come out.

reviewText:
This game is ♥♥♥. I mean its asssssss.
This game is one of those its so bad its good kind of games. I bought it for about 3-4e, which is around the price you should try to find it for. The graphics are...fair on the PC, but ocasionally some things just look abysmal. Cutscenes are like visual diarrhea, the voice acting is..well it is what it is, its not good.
The animations are clunky and buggy as hell at times which can result in some really fun stuff ocasionally. Like most things in the game.

The sound design is damn weird. Sometimes things might sound alright, but theres a weird reverb effect going on even when its not needed. Gun sounds are buggy as balls at times, you might get into one of those epic breaching scenes, the gun fires in slow motion, but the gun sounds are at normal speed. Mostly the sounds are just ♥♥♥. Even the nazi soldiers sound like asses in uniforms
Oh god, almost forgot the soundtrack, it is some terrible stuff. Makes me want to fill my ears with gasoline and light it up, its f*cking bad! it never even fits the stuff thats going on!

The game also feels like its one of those weird things where they picked random things from random games. You get the breaching stuff from CoD, you get the stone throwing from far cry (which is f*cking useless by the way, but it can glitch out the AI atleast) and so on.
The story is some cheesy sheit too, our hero, hawkings is some reporter guy who kills the whole nazi reich on his own while on a quest for some epik scoop. He takes out the camera 3 times during his quest. No wait, probably 4. I mean he takes the came our during the final cutscene that lasts like 10 seconds. The game ends so stupidly and quickly that I honestly dont think the devs believed that anyone would actually finish the game, well f*ck you! I I finished it!

There is a multiplayer component, but to no ones suprise, no one is playing it so who gives a flying f*ck.

Enemy front is a stinking pile of ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ motherf*cking sh*t, its a bug filled, glitchy ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ mess thats painful to the eyes aswell as the ears, but my god I kind of liked it and I might re-play it at some point. Its a fantastic mess and worth picking up if you want to torture yourself with some doodoo game thats actually kind of fun.

Impressive machine"
-hawkings who probably misread his line"

reviewText:
Well this is another first person shooter based on World War 2. It reminded me of games with not too big maps like Call of duty 2 of some decades ago. The first thing I noticed is the superb and most beautifull soundtrack in the menu. I can listen to that for a long time. That is very very good.

The gameplay is fast. The joining of servers isn't that stable all of the time. I got many disconnect even before being able to join at all. But it was possible after a few attempts. There are some interesting weapons in the game that you can pick from the start.

I still have to figure out if this belongs to the group of most impressive games. If I just listen to the music it is most definitely in the top 5 at least. There is online gameplay but no coop. So you can't fight AI with your online teammates. There are also some nice single player missions.

It is a nice game to have tried and played.

reviewText:
You can tell that a lot of hard work went into this game. This WWII shooter is refreshing to play and very pretty to look at. As a student of WWII, I also like the fact that the game is set with the Polish resistance, something rarely, if ever touched on in previous shooters. The graphics are as demanding on your video card as you'd like to make it, but also offers a legitimate range of performance based settings. Here are some other great aspects to the game:

1. Easy GUI for gameplay and settings.
2. Escapable cutscenes.
3. AI is moderately intelligent.
4. Environment is destructible.
5. Weapons are neatly made, (particularly the Welrod) with awesome sound effects.
6. Sniper usage comes with killcam, but not overwhelmingly so. (Very similar to Sniper Warrior 1,2.)
7. Somewhat linear based progression; however, nice secondary missions popup on the side.
8. Plausible, and somewhat interesting storyline.

I will also say that the game is far more stable than the initial release of any Call of Duty game, and I have played all PC versions of that since the original franchise release over 10 years ago. (Just sayin...)

For World War II fans, this game is a great buy. If you want to experience some advanced, arcade shooter gaming in the WWII shooter genre, why not Enemy Front?

I'm looking forward to watching this game grow. It's a lot of fun! Thanks for an original entry in the WWII genre.Good work devs.

reviewText:
Solid Game
A few things that are rather saddening but..

The Levels feel huge but have very little enemy  activity
The Story feels rather rushed and unexplained (You also feel out of place and like you are meant to know the people already)
The Game is WAY to damn easy even on the most difficult settings you can get, every enemy is a one hit with a K98K Rifle and they have a wonky cover mechanic which causes them to hide in plain site, Health regen is crazy fast putting very little challenge or need for cover in the game.

Over all i feel as though this game is fun but at the same time is made to look at (More of a visual showcase as it is) and the gameplay feels rather sloppy
If you love games like Wolfenstein or Battlefield 1942 style games this isn't it..

This feels like an attempt to bring back the WW2 Shooter to it's COD Roots.

Worth a pickup Maybe anything under $15

reviewText:
Uhm, where do i start.. i had a chance to buy this game with 7 usd and now i am pretty sorry for the purchase.

- The graphics are not so bad but they are very clunky, they get the eye tired soon.
- This game suffers from the invisible object problem, i could not get down the stairs until i get back up again and run down and tried to find the sweet spot to make a single step to get to the objective. This is a shame for the developers..
- Character animations are bad, the lip sync of friendly NPCs is bad, the  priest from the church had some weird body movements and the soldiers in the sewers sometimes got stuck in a endless phantom fast moving loop. I bet this game was made by a single person in his parent's garage..
- The weapons are meh.. clunky sights, weird hitmarks that remind me of disabled objects pointer, very weird choices from the developer.
- I am sorry but i do not believe this game is made with cryengine, i played Crysis 3 and the only similarity is the tiredness to the eye.
I only played a two missions and i think this game could have been awesome in the 2008-2009 but in the 2013-2014-2015 is just a bad overpriced joke. Don't buy it - there are plenty better choices at better money.

reviewText:
as of right now, i cannot reccomend this game, thouigh i dont want to totally pan it, it has potential, it just so far has failed to impress me.

i have been wating a long time for a proper WWII shooter than the industry has abandoned for dime a dozen modernd FPS, and this game looked intriuging, however they put way too much energy into trying to make a visual game and ended up doing a very bad job of it, too much GFX effects and filters and other crap just made the visuals seem over exaggerated and really hinder gameplay. there is a lack of graphics options that one would expect from a game with this many bells and whistles built on cryengine no less. no FOV slider, no way to disable motion blur or DOF (who the hell actually likes these???) no way to turn off the damn lens flares which completely override your vision in many places.

the AI is pretty bad, and seemed a bit robotic and overpowered, shootouts usually ended up with enemys in cover for most of the time and when they did pop out they land instant headshots.

i want to see this game do well, hopefully some better options get pached in and the AI gets some improvment, but right now, i just cannot give this a thumbs up.

reviewText:
The game looks appealing at first -- it's WW2 which is a theme that many people enjoy, and its graphics are spectacular. But, the gameplay is dull and many features don't seem polished enough.

The multiplayer seems to have a poor progression system -- many guns are unlocked at the beginning and it just doesn't feel right.

The singleplayer often involves fighting alone, which is something I personally don't enjoy. There are also not enough checkpoints, and you'll become quite frustrated after playing through a large chunk of a mission and having to rever back is annoying.

The game has potential but there just isn't enough polish to make it worth the time and money, sorry CI Games. I know you probably worked hard on this and we appreciate your time -- it's just the game doesn't play very smoothly.
