reviewText:
I retract every statement I've made: This game is a buggy mess that spends half it's time breaking, the other half actually being broken. Every now and again you'll run into a single enemy or two who act in a reasonable manner, but most of the time every enemy will just be a random psychic who senses you sneaking through brick walls and the shoots you through them, while you get stuck in furniture that spawns 5 seconds after you enter a room.

The story is bland and pointless, the main character a white-washed American who for no reason what so ever shows up in Poland and France during the second world war with not explanation as to how he got there, or why. The game itself states he's a journalist, but this fact never comes into play in the actual game from what I could tell.

The AI is non-existant with enemies who will simply run towards you in the straightest line possible while you mow them down with whatever weapon you've got in your hands at the time. Most weapons a surrealistically precise, meaning that it makes absolutely no different whether you equip a machine gun or a sniper - Iron sights will turn you into the harbinger of Nazi death no matter what. When said Nazi's do decide to fight back, their favorite tactic is to shoot you through walls.

1,5/7.

reviewText: Really good for a WWII shooter. We haven't had one of those in a while. There is Wolfenstein: The New Order but that one's alternate history. Enemy Front uses the CryEngine but some of the textures are low resolution. The game is nice in that it gives you the ability to do either a stealth run or a gun and run. The AI is a little dumb though, since they take a while to notice you. I played on medium difficulty however so I'm not sure if they notice you faster on expert. It is more forgiving however than Sniper Elite in the sense that the enemy doesn't have Eagle Eye and so they won't know exactly where you are and if you manage to lie low for a while and let your detection meter drop, they will stop searching for you but will still remain on guard. The dumb part comes in due to the fact that they lose you simply because you hid behind a box, even though they know you were there a minute ago. The weapons are nice. Ammo is plentiful with open ammo boxes scattered all over the maps. The graphics overall are nothing crazy and could be considered lacking a bit in today's modern age and AAA titles but look better than all the old WWII shooters that we've had so far. I will say that the textures tend to bug out sometimes and take a while to load but they are only few. I've experienced more crashes than texture bugs, usually at the later levels of the campaign. With all that said, it's an otherwise pretty good game and I recommend getting it while it's still on sale right now.

reviewText: This game was nothing but disappointment after disappointment. When I got it I was hoping for a game like the old wolfenstein multiplayer, but instead found that I could not connect to most servers as they often simply timed out due to no dedicated servers available. Those times I did connect to a server the screen either remained black or I had no mouse to select my loadout with. Gameplay itself is extremely mediocre, with the characters moving slowly and feeling rather sluggish while the gunplay itself isn't anything noteworthy. The singleplayer campaign is prone to crashing and being stuck on black screens when loading to a new area, and the AI are pitifully stupid. Overall the game is nothing but a frustration and waste of money, I do not recommend getting it.

reviewText: I rarely review games. In fact this is my second review I have ever written since I played tennis on the Atari. I am very interested games of this genre and have spent many contented hours working my way through a ww2 based game. I was wooed by the the idea of enemy front as it explores theatres of ww2 that have previously been untold. The moral to myself is this. Do not drink and change your mind about an intro. It looks clunky and the physics is awful. I prefered wolfensteins latest flashback bits old skool gameplay  that provided some adrenaline. I wanted this to be good and I feel I have flushed 20 odd quid or $50 or whatever the exchange rate is. Oh and it crashed. alot. If the game had been anything like COD - the-most -recent-WW2-one (but that was ages ago, I'm so **** old and this game is makng me question gaming)  it might have been satisfying. Ho, hum. reviewText:
The graphics of the game look just GREAT. It's the best looking WWII game for sure.
I can run the game on MAX settings at 1080p on my GTX680 with 60fps constantly, the game looks well optimized. (i7, 8GB, Win 8.1).

The gameplay is really good. The guns/shooting feel very quite realistic and hardcore.
The way weapons fire and kick, the muzzle flashes and the sounds... are all pretty good. The hit/damage system and the effects are also really nice.

The story starts good, but the enemies' AI is buggy or something like that. That's a big problem, they should work on the enemies' AI and behaviors, because that's what the singleplayer is based on.
I will write more about the story later becaused I haven't played much yet, I've played played half an hour.

The multiplayer is missing a lot of things. I think they should devolope that thing further.
The server browser doesn't show the server's ping, and thats a problem.
You can't join a server by (double)clicking on the servers name. (You have to select the server and then click Join).
If you are here for the Multiplayer... DON'T! It's not worth it at all, at this point at least. Buy Rising Storm instead.

I liked the game overall, and I really WANT to like it more.
Yet it looks like the game was released eirlier than it should be, and it has some issues. So please work on these issues and on the multiplayer, the game has some great potential.

reviewText: I am not sure why so many people have rated this down, maybe since they paid the full $30 for this game. I personally got this game in the bundle and the way I calculated it out, it came out to be around a dollar for this game, and to me, this game is easily worth that dollar. It is not a AAA game, but it is not an indie game either. It reminds me a lot of Sniper Elite V2, except that you can play as a sniper, or you can use smgs and other assault weapons. However, sometimes when you snipe an enemy, you get a little mini cut-scene that almost looks like the same cut scene from Sniper Elite V2, except it does not show what the bullet actually does to the enemy, it just shows them falling back dead. This is not Splinter cell, but there is a decent stealth option. The bushes sometimes provide cover and sometimes you can be seen through it. I did manage to do an entire mission stealth with no one ever getting alerted. You can tag people, but it sometimes works, and sometimes does not tag them, even if you over over them for a good amount of time.\n\nAs I said in the beginning, I paid around a dollar for this, and I feel I got my money's worth, though I would never buy it full price, or even on sale.

reviewText:
Within my 30 minutes of playing, I have crashed to desktop 7 times. Enjoy wonderful multiplayer maps with missing textures and let's not forget those wonderful pre-order weapons! Just don't try to use any of the scopes on the rifles, whenever I try to use them, I crash to desktop...Not only that, but the game seems to enjoy spawning bots that fall from the sky, then disappear, in multiplayer.

Amazing great WWII experience great fun for the whole family!

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=269560447
I suppose all of the crashes to desktop, missing textures, and people falling from the sky are caused by my PC? That makes a lot of sense.

http://i.imgur.com/GgIl7lU.png
I went to go try the game again, maybe see if I was just being jaded while playing the game...Nope! Guess I can't play today!

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=269662599
So I went to vent. Thought I would talk to my friends about this. No, I can't seem to do that either; Enemy Front likes to use your mic at all times, so don't plan on using Steam voice chat.

reviewText:
played but a few minutes. 'started' a server to view the other maps. only 1 of the 4 - i think it's called barricades - feels ww2ish. no brecourt - no pavlov - no dawnville - no harbor (well, they have one but not really) - no hurtgen. just these small maps. from the trailers it makes you think different. no different than you basic modern day map. all the weapons are cool - but not sure what good a sniper rifle will do. maps too small. i played dm btw.

sounds are awesome. no hand grenades that i could see. no rooftop access - i mean REAL rooftops. didnt see anything destructible (shot at a cardboard box on a table with a heavy caliber machine gun and not a dent). however - the 'distant' sounds aren't right. no matter where on the map the shooting is going on, it seems like its next to you. and the footsteps? sheesh...they're so loud.

i was hoping for much more. if you're a gamer, you will know right off whether you like the feel or not. for me? i'm going back to verdun.

reviewText:
Single Player

Pros - Most photo-realistic, detail rendered WW2 shooter you will ever play. Environments rendered in the most stunning detail I have seen in any game.
Cons - Game play mechanics flawed: on expert" damage to player when shot is so low one could easily run and gun through each level. Enemy AI dumb as cardboard in some ways
date: way too smart in others. ADS gets wonky at times.\n\nVerdict: 6/10. Buy this if you would enjoy a little trip back in time to feel like you were really there and always loved commando type war movies as a kid - this is probably the closest you'll ever get to that
recommended: but don't expect to be extremely satisfied by either the challenge or game play as far as FPS games go."

reviewText:
I REALLY wanted to like this game, it looked good in screenshots and the premise was good (ww2 shooters are like zombies, u can never get enough). However, I was turned off by the poor reviews and hence didnt buy. Then it came up in a Bundle Stars bundle with other games for $5 and so I snapped it up.

Minor issues (these can be excused because of the price of the game):
- The game has this radar that reveals enemy locations, making it far too easy.
- It is not challenging enough, I can use a rifle and clear and entire level in less than 5 mins.
- too many cut scenes and not enough game play.
- Story line tries too hard, its lousy!!
- all the prompts are for a gamepad and not a keyboard.

Major issue:
- the game is a buggy pile of turd. It has locked my computer 3x, and when I die it is either stuck loading forever, it just goes black with the music playing. I cannot alt-tab or anything. I have had to cut power and restart 3x. It tends to do this when I die. Sometimes I have managed to get the game back by thumping keys randomly and it seems to do something. This needs to be fixed and I might change my rating.

reviewText: An overlooked gem of a game set in the world wars.\nhttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_aFjHLzfxy0\nENEMY FRONT is the first truly modern WW2 FPS, featuring stunning visuals, open-ended levels and a richly interactive combat experience that breaks out of the standard model of highly linear scripted FPS experiences, giving the player full freedom to own their playing style. Intense Combat, Sniping, Stealth and Sabotage – all are viable approaches for the player, maximizing player engagement and replayability. Against the visceral backdrop of breathtaking European locales, the player takes on the role of American Robert Hawkins, as he fights hand in hand with Resistance Fighters opposing the Nazi juggernaut in France, Germany, Norway, and during the Warsaw Uprising. - Recommended!

reviewText:
This game was actually good but it has it's ups and downs.

The ups:

+ Epic storytelling and storyline
+ Variety of missions
+ Variety of weapons
+ Three different difficulties to choose from
+ No actual DLC which makes you feel you don't have to pay more for this game

The downs:
- Ridicilous plotholes
- Weird crashing of freezing even with a PC that exceeds the recommended specs
- Sometimes the weapons have unrealistic damage
- AI is incredibly stupid (your own team soldiers) but enemy AI in campaign is like always seeming to hit you whereever you go.

Story (not spoilers): You're Robert Hawkins, a war correspondent who fights with the Polish home army in Warsaw in 1944 while the Europe is still at war. During the course of battle Hawkins goes through a series of flashbacks that started his carreer as a writer and a war correspondant.

I think this game isn't worth the 50 euros but it sure is a great bargain gift. I loved it!

I don't EVER write reviews, so here go's with my first ever.

This isn't a half bad game. Not spectacular, but still rather good. I expected the worst game in history by some of the reviews I have seen on here and on youtube. That said, I am glad I got it in a bundle as opposed to paying £30 or whatever it was when first released.

Overall its action packed and alot of fun. Decent story The multiplayer is sparse but good, and I have enjoyed it so far.
I will finish this, which is rare nowadays.

Side note: The AI is rather stupid, play on Hard mode for a challenge I would recommend.
Also, even low end cpu's can play this on full settings at a steady pace.

reviewText:
I REALLY wanted to like this game, it looked good in screenshots and the premise was good (ww2 shooters are like zombies, u can never get enough). However, I was turned off by the poor reviews and hence didnt buy. Then it came up in a Bundle Stars bundle with other games for $5 and so I snapped it up.

Minor issues (these can be excused because of the price of the game):
- The game has this radar that reveals enemy locations, making it far too easy.
- It is not challenging enough, I can use a rifle and clear and entire level in less than 5 mins.
- too many cut scenes and not enough game play.
- Story line tries too hard, its lousy!!
- all the prompts are for a gamepad and not a keyboard.

Major issue:
- the game is a buggy pile of turd. It has locked my computer 3x, and when I die it is either stuck loading forever, it just goes black with the music playing. I cannot alt-tab or anything. I have had to cut power and restart 3x. It tends to do this when I die. Sometimes I have managed to get the game back by thumping keys randomly and it seems to do something. This needs to be fixed and I might change my rating.

reviewText: An overlooked gem of a game set in the world wars.\nhttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_aFjHLzfxy0\nENEMY FRONT is the first truly modern WW2 FPS, featuring stunning visuals, open-ended levels and a richly interactive combat experience that breaks out of the standard model of highly linear scripted FPS experiences, giving the player full freedom to own their playing style. Intense Combat, Sniping, Stealth and Sabotage – all are viable approaches for the player, maximizing player engagement and replayability. Against the visceral backdrop of breathtaking European locales, the player takes on the role of American Robert Hawkins, as he fights hand in hand with Resistance Fighters opposing the Nazi juggernaut in France, Germany, Norway, and during the Warsaw Uprising. - Recommended!

reviewText: When a game tries to implement the best parts of every other game in it's genre, but forgets to actually polish the gameplay, you end up with a disaster. Enemy Front has the sniper ballistics from Sniper Elite, the gunplay from Call of Duty,  and the lense flare from Battlefield 3. Sounds like it could be a reciper for a lot of fun (except for the fricking BF3 lighting glare/lens flare), but it's not. The game is so glitchy and unpolished, it feels like a beta version of most other FPS'.\n\nIs it worth the time? Sure, ignore the glitchiness and it's a mindless and (mostly)fun shooter....But it's not worth the money.  I'd wait for a sale before shelling out for this game.

reviewText:
This is the story of how the Polish resistance achieved victory in their monumental struggle against their Nazi oppressors because they had an American on their side. This untrained American reporter also travels around helping French and Norwegian partisans because he wants to be famous or something.

He uses his regenerating health and some rudimentary stealth mechanics to accomplish the impossible – killing some braindamaged German soldiers. All the while he has to wrestle with far more personal foes: a total lack of personality as well as his arsenal switching to the default weapons every fifteen minutes.

On his generic and contrived adventure our hero discovers that the French and Norwegians have a high standard of living, as their countries don’t consist of restrictingly linear corridors like Warsaw does. And when he kicks open a door and goes into scripted bullet time for the fifth time, he has time to reflect on his epic battle against these Germans who are the only people in Europe not required to speak English for his benefit. And he thinks: “This is kinda fun, I guess. But I wouldn’t pay 29,99€ for the experience.”

reviewText:
I bought this game only because it is a Polish production. Now (as always) my pros and cons:

+ beautiful graphics
+ gives you great view on the history of Warsaw Uprising
+ on the easy difficult level you will relax
+ nice option to do missions in the stealth mode instead of walking around like Rambo or Duke Nukem and destroying everything.

- simple (too simple) plot
- my PC was almost burning - no or almost no code optimization
- AI is so briliant, they will find you wherever you hide after they turn red (alerted), so don't expect it to be FPS Commandos
- once you hit the button for using grenade or other burst weapons, you cannot stop
- lots of bugs like windows, buildings corners or holes in the buildings you cannot shot through (killed myself few times with RPG that way :/ )
- I think it misses some extra text in outro like: what was the outcome of the uprising and how it ended for the soldiers in the future (like what USSR did). It would be good for spreading the history. But creators didn't do that sadly.

Multiplayer looks nice, but it is empty :(
voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText:
This game attempted to revive WWII FPS with marginal results. Its worth buying, yes, but only in a steam sale. You got a solid 6 hour campaign, that's too small in my book but that's what we've kind of grown used to in the FPS market. These companies hope that their multiple player will carry their game and focus time on that when in reality adding a coop mode would have been better and adding 3ish more hours. I'm sure they have plenty of really great looking multiple player maps but we'll never see them because these games never garner any kind of multiple player community.

The levels are all beautifully rendered and the voice acting was really good. The storyline was choppy with jumping around. You start in Poland then flash to France where you meet this potential love interest then you never return to her and then all of a sudden you're back in Poland then Norway and then Poland then in Germany to end in Poland. If that sentence confused you, now imagine the storyline. You wouldn't read a book that every chapter was out of order and you wouldn't watch a (non-indie) movie where the plot jumped around so why did the developers think you'd want to play a game like that? They should have focused in maybe two of the locations Warsaw and France. I'm all for starting in the middle in a story- en medias reas - but it works in the classic literature because they only do it once. This jumping around wasn't needed.

As far as gameplay all the weapons are too accurate- besides the sniper rifle. That goes for the weapons you shoot as the player and the enemy. Often I would get Germans shooting through concealment to hit me when I couldn't see them and they shouldn't have been able to see me. I remember getting hit by a guy who only had about an inch gap to shoot through. Also, your character is horrible at throwing things. I burned myself to death a few times throwing a molotov out of a doorway only to have it splatter on the doorframe.

Like I said above though, the levels are solid, the game play is fast pace and not dull and I have to say again, the voice acting was very good. it just fell flat because the storyline looked like someone mixed the level orders up.

reviewText:
If you want to spend your hard earned money. don't spen more than 5$ on this game. This game has beautiful graphics (except those exagerated flashes of light) but that's all it has to offer. Playing through the solo campain, all I could think of was: boring. As other mentionned, this game is like the first Medal of honor ou Call of duty but at least, those games were engaging. Enemy Front isn't, at all.

Cutscene are in ridiculous resolution. I also had to reload many times because the game would crash on loading. On a missing where you blow a building, I died trying to explore a little and after, the building would collapse on me as soon as the game loaded. Very frustrating. Searching for secrets is like looking for metal piece of crap which is also boring. The AI is really dumb. They just run through your crossair like kamikaze with their weapons in their pants. I mean, come on, this is an insult for war FPS games. Steam achievements could be cool but I didn't bother to go through the game a second time since it doesn't worth it. In fact, it doesn't even worth the first time...

Note to myself: Stop giving chances to games with a Metacritic score below 70.

reviewText: I do recommend this, but it comes with some caveats. The game is fun, not really immersive, but fun. The graphics are decent, not mind blowing, but it's easily the best looking WW2 shooter there is. While it IS a WW2 shooter, it isn't a classic one, the closest thing to it would be MoH:Underground for the Playstation, way back in the day. There a few things that are really off about the game: The first is it's supposed to have stealth as part of what it's about, but stealth is 100% not gonna happen, enemies see you when they shouldn't, and the don't when they should. The second is the ability to throw rocks to distract enemies. It doesn't work, the actual game mechanic for that action simply doesn't work right. Far Cry 3 and 4 got it right, 3 more than 4, but even 4 is worlds above where EF is at with that very important game mechanic. The cross hairs are, to me, really...odd. They don't fit the weapons, and so don't fit the game. The player is only able to toggle iron sights, I've found no way to actually hold iron sights without staying on the mouse button. Unlike almost every game out there now, the player can't go prone. The player CAN, though, do crouch slides, which is becoming a thing"

reviewText:
Pros:
Good graphics and nice scenery.

Nice setting especially in France.

Has some cool features like hostage taking, silent knifing, bullet time ect…

Nice selection of weapons.


Cons:
What a glitchy mess. The game crashes or freezes practically after every chapter.

Very linear game. A to B and when there are optional objectives you get no rewards for completing them.

They tried to implement stealth but failed. Basically you are punished for doing anything but run and gun.

The story line is pathetic.

Obnoxious missions that require holding the line with infinite spawning enemies until you complete the objective.

Summary:
If you need to play a WW2 game and want pretty decent graphics then give it a try. I would not pay full price for it EVER. But on sale for $5-$10 I would say its worth it.

reviewText:
Sometimes you just need a MEH button.  Get it on sale, but only if you have the patience to deal with the buggy, incomplete gameplay.

Man, what a slog to manage to finish the SP campaign on this.  Light sources started glitching out after a crash in one of the last couple of levels, that only went away by changing some of the advanced graphics settings.
An infuriating bug is one where you would set an explosive charge and then would be stuck there, unable to move until it exploded.  Not bad if some or most of them weren't FREAKING MANDATORY.  There were also places where you hold F to climb up, and once in awhile, the prompt would not register unless you restarted at the last checkpoint.  On a single playthrough, I got stuck in holes in the terrain, no less than 5 times.  (Stay off the ice inside the water plant...i'm jus' sayin')
The stealth aspects are terribly implemented.  There is a gauge that shows your discovery, but it has no directional marker that I can see, so you have no idea who can see you, and they can be really far away.  The binoculars are supposed to mark where the bad guys are, but half the time, they can be in plain view and the mark won't work.  Also, sometimes you can walk right up in front of the guy and he won't see you, and yet there is a guy half way across the map that sees you instantly, even though you are crouched behind something.  Not that staying stealthy matters, you can just go loud and wait for the dummies to come around the corner, one by one, just like lambs to the slaughter.
The story is a disjointed mess that has you jumping all over the place, in and out of the Polish front, to occupied France, and even deep into Germany.  The last mission, especially, feels like corners were cut at the last minute and shoved out the door with huge gaps in the story.
So, I am loathe to recommend this game, and yet I almost feel compelled to on account of it being one of the only WWII shooters to come out recently.   Seeing as how the next COD is likely going to be a ridiuclous, futuristic, bunch of space nonsense, this at least scratches that WWII shooter itch until they come to their senses.

The multiplayer is dead quiet but this is a good game if you have a huge interest in weapons used in the era and you like bringing the fight as resistance. The story takes a stroll through countries you've never played through, Poland, Denmark, and a pinch of France. I'd recommend this game.

reviewText:
Pros:
Good graphics and nice scenery.

Nice setting especially in France.

Has some cool features like hostage taking, silent knifing, bullet time ect…

Nice selection of weapons.


Cons:
What a glitchy mess. The game crashes or freezes practically after every chapter.

Very linear game. A to B and when there are optional objectives you get no rewards for completing them.

They tried to implement stealth but failed. Basically you are punished for doing anything but run and gun.

The story line is pathetic.

Obnoxious missions that require holding the line with infinite spawning enemies until you complete the objective.

Summary:
If you need to play a WW2 game and want pretty decent graphics then give it a try. I would not pay full price for it EVER. But on sale for $5-$10 I would say its worth it.

As a game it wants to be Sniper Elite but falls way short of that. Very linear, no gun upgrades, to experience, walk-run-jump and same hit aim, comic bullet balistics, sneak option a waste of time - run in guns blazing is just as good. Enemy AI samey... and the list goes on.

reviewText: Firstly I would like to say that I don't know why so many people hate this game. Besides some minor glitches and some crashes that people may get. The game is fantastic in my opinion, the artwork of the towns, weapons, and uniforms are spot on and they were not rushed like some other games. The uniforms on enemy soldiers, are highly detail showing every badge, patch, and detail on them. The towns are amazing, the mountains in the distance look so realistic. The gameplay is fine in my opinion, it all works well and is also realistic. The storyline, which is a big factor in this game, is very easy to follow. It is a believing storyline, which also gives you a taste of the resistance fighters of WWII. I have yet to see any other game that covered a storyline of people of the resistice factor of the war. So all in all, I highly recommend this game if you are looking for a realistic, correctly detailed features, and a great WWII FPS. Thanks for reading, I hope this was healpful.

reviewText: Enemy Front is a casual, artfully rendered Nazi-killing funtime. The gameplay is easy and the story is slightly cheesy, but I  enjoy the immersion in this significant historical time. I am compelled to write my first ever Steam review for this game (and I am playing some awesome games these days!), because it is a shame that it has mixed reviews. I waited 6 months for it to go on sale, before I finally puchased it. I think if you take Enemy Front for what it says it is, and for what most of the positive reviews say it is, you will not be disappointed. The ONLY reason it might be slightly overpriced is because of the short length of the story.\n7.5/10

reviewText:
PROS:
- Nice graphics.
- Missions in different geographies (Poland, Norway, France etc.)
- Stealth mode where you can take enemies from down without getting noticed and throw stones to distract the enemy etc. Also outer noises can cover your shots and keep you unnoticed. What I liked the most about the game. You do not always have to kill every single German soldier to get things done.

CONS:
- Crashes time to time. Does not make the game unplayable but is annoying.
- Relatively short. Took me 9 hours to finish.
- Lots of rambo style missions where you sneak into an entire German military camp or facility and need to complete the mission just by yourself  such as the missions with" Dietrich. I personally like missions where you fight within a small squad a lot better such as the Russian campaign of Call of Duty rather than one-man-army style ones.

Overall
date:
the game did give me the WWII FPS experience I was looking for at a reasonable price but is definitely not a COD.

Sometimes you just need a MEH button.  Get it on sale, but only if you have the patience to deal with the buggy, incomplete gameplay.

Man, what a slog to manage to finish the SP campaign on this.  Light sources started glitching out after a crash in one of the last couple of levels, that only went away by changing some of the advanced graphics settings.
An infuriating bug is one where you would set an explosive charge and then would be stuck there, unable to move until it exploded.  Not bad if some or most of them weren't FREAKING MANDATORY.  There were also places where you hold F to climb up, and once in awhile, the prompt would not register unless you restarted at the last checkpoint.  On a single playthrough, I got stuck in holes in the terrain, no less than 5 times.  (Stay off the ice inside the water plant...i'm jus' sayin')
The stealth aspects are terribly implemented.  There is a gauge that shows your discovery, but it has no directional marker that I can see, so you have no idea who can see you, and they can be really far away.  The binoculars are supposed to mark where the bad guys are, but half the time, they can be in plain view and the mark won't work.  Also, sometimes you can walk right up in front of the guy and he won't see you, and yet there is a guy half way across the map that sees you instantly, even though you are crouched behind something. reviewText:
I bought this game only because it is a Polish production. Now (as always) my pros and cons:

+ beautiful graphics
+ gives you great view on the history of Warsaw Uprising
+ on the easy difficult level you will relax
+ nice option to do missions in the stealth mode instead of walking around like Rambo or Duke Nukem and destroying everything.

- simple (too simple) plot
- my PC was almost burning - no or almost no code optimization
- AI is so briliant, they will find you wherever you hide after they turn red (alerted), so don't expect it to be FPS Commandos
- once you hit the button for using grenade or other burst weapons, you cannot stop
- lots of bugs like windows, buildings corners or holes in the buildings you cannot shot through (killed myself few times with RPG that way :/ )
- I think it misses some extra text in outro like: what was the outcome of the uprising and how it ended for the soldiers in the future (like what USSR did). It would be good for spreading the history. But creators didn't do that sadly.

Multiplayer looks nice, but it is empty :(

Sometimes you just need a MEH button.  Get it on sale, but only if you have the patience to deal with the buggy, incomplete gameplay.

Man, what a slog to manage to finish the SP campaign on this.  Light sources started glitching out after a crash in one of the last couple of levels, that only went away by changing some of the advanced graphics settings.
An infuriating bug is one where you would set an explosive charge and then would be stuck there, unable to move until it exploded.  Not bad if some or most of them weren't FREAKING MANDATORY.  There were also places where you hold F to climb up, and once in awhile, the prompt would not register unless you restarted at the last checkpoint.  On a single playthrough, I got stuck in holes in the terrain, no less than 5 times.  (Stay off the ice inside the water plant...i'm jus' sayin')
The stealth aspects are terribly implemented.  There is a gauge that shows your discovery, but it has no directional marker that I can see, so you have no idea who can see you, and they can be really far away.  The binoculars are supposed to mark where the bad guys are, but half the time, they can be in plain view and the mark won't work.  Also, sometimes you can walk right up in front of the guy and he won't see you, and yet there is a guy half way across the map that sees you instantly, even though you are crouched behind something.  Not that staying stealthy matters, you can just go loud and wait for the dummies to come around the corner, one by one, just like lambs to the slaughter.
The story is a disjointed mess that has you jumping all over the place, in and out of the Polish front, to occupied France, and even deep into Germany.  The last mission, especially, feels like corners were cut at the last minute and shoved out the door with huge gaps in the story.
So, I am loathe to recommend this game, and yet I almost feel compelled to on account of it being one of the only WWII shooters to come out recently.   Seeing as how the next COD is likely going to be a ridiuclous, futuristic, bunch of space nonsense, this at least scratches that WWII shooter itch until they come to their senses.

reviewText:
I got this game on sale for 5 dollars.

It's worth the 5 i reckon but not 30.

The game has amazing and beautiful graphics and scenery but sadly its just too linear. It reminds me of MOH warfighter campaign where it just becomes frustrating and tiring to push through anymore.

Also Multiplayer is dead but if you have a friend that owns the game i guess you could start a game and can get them to join.

I'll give it a thumbs up because i feel its worth the 5 dollars.... if i paid 30 i'd be super angry!.

reviewText:
Bought this game during a steam sale right when it came out and was largely dissapointed. I'm a huge WW2 fanboy so I tried really hard to like it but the game worked harder to make me hate it, and ultimately succeeded:

Gun firing sounds not going off until well after weapons have been shot
Being seen by enemies through walls who then run into said wall and just keep running
Random freezes
Sniping at an enemies head, only having the bullet to not register and then having a whole army on me at once

The cut scenes where the protagonist goes on the Polish radios are really cringe, the friendly AI is completely ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥, and the story is pretty ♥♥♥♥. On the plus side, the graphics are pretty good and sometimes the physics were really impressive, such as the blood spatter.
There are collectables, but they do absolutely nothing, there's nothing to unlock. Often times, you finish a level with a good loadout of weapons, only to have them taken away from you in the next level, which happens right after.
This game is a total throwback for the MoH games, which I loved so it's hard to say this but I can't recommend this game to anyone except the hardcore WW2 fan.
